ygData.subject: Re: [[EQ_women] Luclin fun]
ygData.msgSnippet: i think its fantastic... but if you want to enjoy the full graphical nature of it... you need a very nice computer... to see the new charcter models and stuff,
ygData.messageBody:
i think its fantastic... but if you want to enjoy the full graphical nature
of it... you need a very nice computer... to see the new charcter models and
stuff, you need MINIMUM 256mb ram, recomended is 512mb... Geforce or better
video card etc.... but the graphics are amazing. and all the old world and
previsous expansions are all retextured and looking good too. there is a
new race, the Vah Shir (cat like people) and 1 new class (beast lord).
There are also many special 51+ abilities also now... you get ability exp
besides normal exp, and you can tell what % of your exp you want to go to
abilities instead of level exp... some really cool abilities... some
general ones are running speed, regen speed... base stats and resist
raising... then theres (at 55+) a cetegory based on if your a caster, melee,
priest type... etc... with cool skills... mana regen, crit hits chances(even
for non warriors) etc... then there are class specific abilities at 59+ ...
many are cool, like clerics get one thats 100% exp rez with full hps and
mana and no rez effects... and all kinds of powerful stuff... 2 people can
be level 60 now, and 1 can be twice as powerful as the other without even
looking at equipment...


>From: <judy3t@...>
>Reply-To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
>To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [[EQ_women] Luclin fun]
>Date: 6 Dec 2001 17:53:52 MST
>
> > So is everyone having fun in Luclin?
>
>Didn't know it was out. Can you tell us a bit about it? Getting a little
>bored in Albion *sigh*. Are there new classes and races one can try out?
>That might bring me to Luclin for a bit to see.
>
>Trying to play an MMORPG with only 3-10 hours a week is a challenge. It's
>hard to stay connected to the community with that little time. And I will
>never again have the time to devote to a plane raid. Hmmm... maybe I don't
>have the lifestyle for this anymore *cries pitifully*
>
>Ice
>
